chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jalin Josiah Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jalin Josiah Bell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jalin Josiah Bell was found guilty of Handgun Transfer-Buyer Give False Info, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 175.35(2e).
  • Jalin Josiah Bell was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Jalin Josiah Bell was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Jalin Josiah Bell was found guilty of Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 2 but concurrent with counts 4, 6 and any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jalin Josiah Bell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Jalin Josiah Bell.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 4, AND 6:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 7 AND 8 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Terry B. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 146 days time served. The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $500. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 but CONCURRENT to Counts 4, 6, and any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 4: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 but CONCURRENT to Counts 3, 6, and any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 6: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 but CONCURRENT to Counts 3, 4, and any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Provide DNA sample. 
- Driver's license revoked for 6 MONTHS as to Count 6.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school). 
- Complete 100 hours of community service.  
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Complete 8 hours of in person driver's education. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete a cognitive thinking program. 
- Work on obtaining a HS diploma/GED/HSED. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay the fine as to Count 2 during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) as to all counts due to a finding of indigency.  If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that the fine be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Jalin J. Bell - #2022006253, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion for Bail Modification.  (Jalin J. Bell - #2022006253, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for level 5 SUPERVISION.  All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Court unable to move forward with arraignment due to a filing issue.  Court rescheduled arraignment hearing.   Defense requests to be heard as to bail.  Arguments heard.  Court reduced cash bail.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Motion to Modify Bail

Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective G. Gonzales.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and granted in part. Count 1 is dismissed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial on Counts 2, 3, 4, 6, 7 & 8. State requests an arraignment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Arraignment scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Vincent Guimont
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Manuel C H and Saalhir C, or any gun stores.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jalin Josiah Bell in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jalin Josiah Bell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to dismiss count 1 argued and denied by the court. Court grants defense motion to dismiss count 5. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
